intro: Geocaryum macrocarpum, commonly known as the giant earthstar, is a unique fungal-like plant that belongs to the order Pterosporangiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped fruiting bodies that emerge from the soil, resembling a cluster of small, inflated sacs. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its reproductive structures release spores into the air, facilitating its spread. Despite its fungal-like appearance, it is classified as a true plant, belonging to the group called liverworts.
